intro: Phoradendron conzattii var. tecomatlanum, commonly known as the Tecomatlan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in its native range. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are a food source for birds and other animals. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its parasitic nature, it can affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
